1.content:
The sun is setting on the plagued Raccoon City, fires are raging in damaged buildings and screams echoing through the town are as common as the wind now.
The hell spans for miles, the city large. No outside force has been contacted, nor gotten word.
The remaining citizens of the town are trying their best to survive but are turning into the monsters left and right from the viruses ravaging the city.

Whos fate will you control?
1.title: Enter the Nightmare

11.content:
"All right.. stay calm. Stay.. calm." Jack meditated on as he sat on the couch of his home, staring at the television which held a constant beep as the signal error played across the screen. Jack hand his elbows on his knees, his head in his hands as he rustled his fingers through his hair.
Jack rose his head again and looked outside his window, seeing the setting sun and the night approaching. The smoke and ash which filled the sky made the sun nothing but a blur on the horizon, the night not darkening some areas of the city as they were lit by huge fires and the like.
Jack lived in a relitively rural area of town, the night bringing darkness as the street outside was lit by a buzzing street light. The giant glow outside was that of the plagued Raccoon City, lit up like a christmas ornament.

Jack calmed himself down, hoping to hear the comforting sounds of police sirens yet none came immediately. He figured all police force must be concentrated in the city itself and not the outskirts like where his one-story home was.
Jack wiped his face once more as if something were on it, then standing and walking to the bathroom and looking into the mirror clamped onto the medicine cabinet.
After a while of meditating on his image, Jack ran the tap on the sink, a hissing sound made as only little spurts of water came out.
Jack turned the tap back off and walked back to his couch, looking out the window again, hoping he was just imagining the whole thing. He wasn't.

Jack decides that he needs to..
11.title: Enter Jack.

111.content:
Jack comes to a conclusion, staring out the window towards the burning city.
" I can't stay here.. " Jack decided, figuring that if he stayed he would eventually die. From either lack of food and water or something else may happen to him, Jack was still in the dark about the situation. Jack only knew that the scnario that was playing out was a horrible one.
Jack went to the coffee table near the front door of his home, and grabbed his car keys.
The jingling of the keys made him feel a bit better, as though he were a child and were entertained by the noise.
The noise reminded Jack as if it were a normal day, and he was going out for groceries and not to escape. A fierce howl in the distance soon brought him back to reality.
Jack stepped out into the cold air of night, the grass on his lawn still green and lucious, this also gave Jack some peace at mind. Jack went around the right corner of his house, stepping cautiously as he peeked around the corner, he wasn't sure what could be around the corner. It could be the boogey man for all he cared, he just knew he woke up one afternoon on the couch and the city was a war zone.

Jack saw his car underneath the metal tent he had installed to keep leaves from a nearby tree from blowing into his car's hood and coming through the air conditioning system.
Jack made a fair amount of money, his vehicle showed it, it was a sporty car; black, with a convertable roof.
Jack stepped towards his car when he stopped, noticing..
111.title: Leaving home.

choices: Ran to his car, and jumped in.  Locking the door.
Grabbed a near by gardening shovel.
1111.content:
Jack stopped dead in his tracks, he heard the rustling of leaves behind him as if they were being stepped on. The crackling of twigs and the brushing of grass. Jack stood still, frightened that it was a monster or something that could bring harm to him. He turned around slowly, hesitant to look at whatever it was, Jack was greeted by a lumbering man limping towards him. Jack let a sigh of relief as he figured it was just one of his neighbors, coming to ask what was going on. Jack soon lost his state of comfort when the man's upper body came into light of the newly risen moon, visible more clearly now.
"Oh my god.." Jack whispered to himself, looking at the man skulking towards him, the man's mouth was pasted with red, dripping with yellow fluid. The man's eyes were disturbing and dry, fixed on him. The ghastly being's shoulder also was bare, the crusted clothing around it had been torn, and the flesh on his shoulder had been tore out into a dark mess, flesh hanging and red gore dripping from the man's shoulder yet spastic movements noted that he had not lost control of the arm.
The limping beast froze Jack in his tracks, just staring as the creature limped ever closer before Jack..
1111.title: First Encounter.

choices: Go forwards, try to go through the flimsey alluminum bars.
Back up, take out the creature.
11111.content:
Jack jumped into movement, hesitantly turning his back on the creature and running to his car. He swiftly stuck the key in and unlocked the mechanism on the door, opening it and jumping in. Jack slammed the door, a loud thud made followed by the click of Jack re-locking the door, as well as making sure the rest of the car was secure.
Jack looked behind him, out the rear window back at the monster, it was still progressing to the car.
Jack couldn't go forwards, there were two bars supporting the metal tent that would hinder him. Back was the only possible choice of movement for the vehicle, and the creature was too close to avoid if he were to back up.
Jack decides that his best choice is to..
11111.title: Between a rock and a hard place.

111111.content:
Jack wasn't the man to just run over someone, no matter how they looked. He decided he'd try his luck heading through the bars infront of him. Jack started the car, turning the key hard as the engine roared into animation. Jack took a deep breath and said a silent prair as he held the breaks on his front wheels and got his back wheels warming up, spinning them as the noise confused the lumbering creature as it let out a echoing moan. Jack's heart skipped a beat as he heard the moan, he also dazzled himself into thinking it was right next to him as he let go of the break as the car jumped into movement..
.
.
.
.
BAM!
Jack broke through the gate of alluminum and was tearing through his back lawn, quickly collecting himself and turning a sharp left to head onto the road. The baffled creature stood there, watching the car speed away as it returned to it's moaning song of agony. Jack was in a cold sweat, he made it onto the road with a bump from coming off the side walk. Jack slid onto the right lane, and sped towards the intimidating city as it glew a dim orange.
" I have to get help.. " Jack thought to himself, fantasies of a well-armed police force ready to welcome Jack into their protection brought him hope. Unfortunately for Jack, he would not get his greeting upon arrival to the city's urban areas. Upon entering the city..

Looking around he sees the street littered with abandoned cars and trash. The smell of rotten flesh snakes its way into the car causing a gagging that soon fades.
"Now Entering Raccoon City" Jack says aloud to him reading the sign doing his best adjust to the stench.
The sight of a dismembered child comes into Jacks view as he turns his head back at the road. The small girl no older than eight holds her remaining arm up in protest before the front of Jack's car slams into her. Jack is blinded as the airbag deploys into his face. The sound of screeching tires come to an abrupt stop as the car slams into the bed of a pickup truck.
"Ugggghhhhh" Jack blurts out pushing the bag down gaining his perception of the situation. The sound of silence is soon objected to with the beating of the little girl hand. She groans slamming her fist down onto the hood swaying side to side. Her body's fluid's mix with the antifreeze causing a slurry of red and green with run onto the ground. The girls screaming grows louder and Jack Pushes onto his door. Lucky it only gives slight resistance, and he steps out onto the street.
Looking around Jack sees a cluster of buildings most of them abandoned or without of business signs in the windows. Jack sees a man, in his mid 30's with his back turned to Jack, gnawing on a carcass and seems to have not noticed Jack yet. Looking forward to Jack can see that the door to the convenience store has been pushed open. If he can just sneak by the man, he can get in the store and close the door behind him.

1111221121.content:
You glance into your rear-view mirror, only to see the group of people with their limbs broken and bent at strange angles running after you. You quickly push your foot further down on the gas pedal, and glance back out the front window, only to see more of these people running at you from the front. You slam on the brakes again, and swerve to the right this time, barely avoiding most of the group but still hitting one. You knock this person right at the waist, severing his body in half, and have no choice but to watch him flailing about on your car hood. As you swerve back and forth trying to remove this flailing body off your car, you see blood smearing, blocking your ability to see out clearly.

You swerve first to the left, then to the right, staying completely in control of the car to try and get rid of the person on the hood. The half-body stopped flailing on the hood now, and despite it still being there, you figure that the remains of life finally has died from it. You straighten out the car and continue driving, trying to figure out where you are now. You look out the small remains of the window that isn't smeared with blood, and notice you are leaving the Raccoon City limits. Blocks of trees rush past you, and you ease your foot off the gas pedal now, the street lights long past you now, you start to realize you are lost.

You ease the car to a stop, and sit in complete silence. Your eyes focus in the low-light setting that you are sitting in, to notice pieces of flesh caught in the half-body sitting in front of you. Turning the vehicle off, you listen to the complete utter silence, no wind, no chirping; no cricket noises. You figure it's safe, and as carefully as you can, you get out of your car. You decide to reach forward from your car and try to remove the half-body from your window. As you reach forward the body's eyes snap open, and it starts thrashing and biting at you, the arms reaching forward and the fingers grasping onto your shirt. It yanks on you, throwing you slightly off balance, and pulling you closer, as it pulls itself forward. You reach into your back pocket and pull out a knife case. You yank the knife from the case and thrust it forward, driving the blade deep into it's arm actually noticing the blade break through to the other side. You drag the blade further down it's arm, cutting through the skin and bone. You frown as the beast still keeps thrashing and grasping and at the fact there is no blood seeping from the fresh wound.

You try to pull out the knife from its arm and realize it's stuck....
Do you

11112211212.content:
Realizing that this monster's going to bite you an probably take your hand off, you punch it. The creature rears back, and the knife you jammed in its arm gets caught on a mirror while the beast flails its arms and pops out. Snatching it up, you quickly jam the blade into the demon's head. All its struggles stop the instant it penetrates the skull, and you breathe a sigh of relief. You drag the slab of meat off your car, but when you turn around you see two Asians staring at you. You freak out and almost lunge for them, but realize they both are weeping. There is a younger girl, and an old man dressed in a Japanese army uniform. He puts out a hand and yells "Stop! We are not demons! I recognize these creatures from experiments I have seen and from movies. They are turning more people into demons by biting them and spreading the sickness," at this he took a deep breath and rolled up his bloody sleeve. "I have been bitten, but have slayed many! I do not wish to die as a beast. I will still see Hell's light, but I shall greet the a man. Please...take care of my Akika for me. She is all this foolish old man has left." The tears rolled down this old man's wrinkled cheeks. The girl, Akika, sobbed uncontrollably. He murmured something reassuring to her in Japanese. She nodded, still weeping.
"Please assist me in Seppuku. I will stab myself in my stomach, you must remove my head." You paled, and began to refuse but his eyes grew steely. He handed you a gleaming, bloody, sword. The soldier took a dagger from a scabbard. Quickly, he jabbed it deep inside his stomach. In his last moments, he gazed at you imploringly, the life draining from his eyes. Sterling yourself, you swung the sword and neatly removed his head. The girl sobbed as you led her to the car.

112.content:
Jack decides that he needs to stay indoors.

Jack stood there for awhile, staring at the window, sighing in disbelief. Jack close his eyes as he try to understand why or who is responsible for all this, but its too much to comprehend, who could? This whole situation doesn't make sense. Its like a scene straight from a horror movie. Like you've been sucked inside the twisted mind of a serial killer. A nightmare of epic proportion. As he grasp the cold hard reality he realized that it doesn't matter. What matter is to stay safe, stay alive and hope that all of this will end soon, real soon.

"To do that, where else would be better than in the comfort of your own home." Jack thought. Jack dust himself off with a new profound sense of goal. First on his agenda, "Protection". Jack is an able handyman, well knowledgeable of tools and wood works. With already reinforced doors and windows he could easily turn his simple two-story bungalow into a well fortified fortress in no time.

"A solid plan i might say." Jack said, but this is where Jack found himself in a difficult dilemma. Supplies. With no running water and food supply are well in-doubt staying alive will be proven difficult. His rations will last a couple of more days, probably a week if he try to conserve.

"Perfect day to go shopping." Jack muttered to himself.

He feels going outside is extremely dangerous. He's always relied on his instincts and it never put him astray. "Staying inside will be the best decision, stay inside and wait for help to arrive." Is what his gut is telling him. He always played it safe, but this problem cannot be ignored and he knows he has to gamble with death if he is to stay alive.

Jack is now faced with a difficult situation...
112.title: Protection

12.content:
10:00p.m. Akika is leaving the library. "why can't I understand any of this material?" Akika whispers to herself a little angrilly. She's not one of the kids at her school more interested in popularity and fashion, and she's not one of the slower kids she just has a hard time understanding and that has reflected in her recent grades.

Akika walks down the lit street, glancing at her watch, 10:06. The bus will be here in 9 minutes. Her hair swaying from side to side as she walks, a slight hunch from the weight of the books in her backpack, making her 5'2 stance look even shorter. The wind is making the mid May night feel unusually cold for a school kilt but she wears it well. Akika comes to the bus stop at 10:13 hoping that the bus hasn't passed early. She has been getting in these late night study sessions lately and the bus driver, Mr. Kent has been nice enough to wait for her 2-3 minutes the few times she's arrived late. 10:17... Maybe he's late tonight, Akika takes a seat in the bus shed and pulls out a chemistry book while she waits. The book seems so big in her lap. 10:34, she got so caught up in her reading that she didn't realize that not only was Mr. Kent really late tonight, but the bus that was scheduled to come after him was late aswell. "What the hell is going on?" Akika packs up her bag and prepares for a 12 block walk to her apartment. She considered calling her roommate for a ride at first but 10:30, her roommate was either out on a date right now, or at home having sex again. It was like a routine for her so Akika decided to let it be and began her walk home.

11:46, only 4 blocks to go. Akika's feet were killing her. She would just sleep when she got home, maybe well into tomarrow and just forget about her classes. As she walked by an alley she could see the shadow of two people, one on top of the other. "Even homeless people need love I guess" she said to herself as she shuddered a little bit, but a shrilling moan from one of the people stopped Akika in her tracks. As she turned around she seen the man crawling out from the alley covered in blood. Barely able to pull himself he locked eyes with her and stretched out a hand to her. Akika's immediate reaction was to jump back and begin a run, but she stopped and looked back again, not knowing what she could do to help him, but not wanting to leave him there.
12.title: Late Night Study

You reach into your purse and grab the pepper spray from it. You silently thank your father for insisting that you carry some with you at all times, your father had never trusted the people in Raccoon City.

You point the nozzle of the pepper spray right at the Bum and push the button. You expect to see the bum stumble and run away, or to at least have his advance toward you slow, but he doesn’t even close his eyes as the jet from your bottle hits him squarely in the face.

You feel your face being torn apart and blood shooting from the hole in your head. You have fought your hardest against this beast, but you have failed. You rapidly feel yourself losing strength as you bleed out.

The last thing you see before you black out is several more shapes moving in your direction, all moaning their hideous cries into the night.

The shadows slowly descend upon Akika Tsugi. Were Akika conscious, she would have remarked upon how odd it was that seemingly normal people were behaving in this manner. Other then the bum, they were all respectable people. A slim 48 year old principal from the local elementary school dressed in, although torn and stained, a high quality business suit. A young looking man in a fire fighter outfit with a large gouge missing from his left calf that looks like a bite mark. Even an old preacher, still holding a partially obscured bible in the front pocket of his shirt.

They all descend upon her and, with relish, begin to feast. They seem to be drawn, like lightning to a lightning rod to her head. They quickly begin pounding and clawing at the remains of Akika’s sweet face tearing apart her bony skull in search of their prize deep inside. With the sound of splitting flesh and cracking bone, they finally reach their treasure, her brain. It is quickly consumed, and they begin working on the rest of her body. Within an hour, Akika is barely recognizable as a human, let alone a young woman.

Two hours after her death she has been completely consumed. Neither bone, flesh, nor hair had escaped the feast. The assembled crowd groan in disappointment that their meal ended so quickly and began shambling off looking for their next meal waddling a bit from the massive amounts of human in their bellies.

14.content:
Laura awoke to the sound of sirens. As her eyes slowly opened, she noticed the faint red and blue coloration that filled the dark room, before disappearing as fast as it came. She swiftly rose and gazed outside her 3rd floor window. She caught the tailights of two police vehicles speeding down her street.
<Another high speed pursuit>, she thought. <Two down the same street in a day. I'd hate to be the poor bastards that protect and serve around here.>
Curiosity soon passed, and she found herself laying back down to the wonderful realm of sleep. Before sleep could find her, a knock on the door found her first.
"Mmmmm... who is it?"
"Raccoon Police Department, ma'am."
Laura's eyes narrowed as she wondered what the hell would they be doing here. She rose again, and with newfound dizziness in her brain, she crossed the small apartment room to the door and peered through the eyehole. A middle-aged uniform man stood outside, appearing to be staring straight back at her. She hesitated, then cautiously unlocked and opened the door.
"Ma'am, my name is Officer Cameron. I'll have to ask you to come with me," the officer said.
"Why," asked Laura, "What's the problem?"
"Ma'am..."
"Laura."
"Laura, we are evacuating citizens of the city. There is an extreme situation, so please hurry. My car is downstairs..."
"Woah, woah, wait a minute, what's happening? A bomb threat or something?"
Officer Cameron looked nervous and in a hurry. "I'll explain in the squad car. Please hurry, grab what you need, and come downstairs with me."
14.title: The first choice.

141.content:
Deciding that this man is only trying to help, she followed Officer Cameron down the hall towards the elevator. She didn't bring much with her, just her cell phone, purse, and a decorative dagger that was handed down by her mother, now deceased. The dagger itself was beautiful, a sharpened 6-inch blade with a golden handle, and a gold-laced steel sheath to go with it. It was the only protection she could muster from her luggage, and the only item she felt she needed, as it was handed down from her family for generations. She would not leave it. She kept it hooked the belt of her jeans, for now.
As they entered the elevator and descended, Laura sternly asked again the situation.

"There's this disease, infection or something going around town," Cameron started. "People are... well, they're not themselves anymore. Every member of the RPD has been called out to try to help, but now the orders are to contain."

Laura was incredulous. "Contain? The entire city? Sounds more like a viral outbreak."

"Could be, I dunno. All I know is my partner was killed by a citizen." Cameron tried hard to choke back a sob. "He was... eaten."

The elevator doors opened and they briskly walked down the new hall to the front door. A police car waited for them outside on the curb. Laura noticed a young man in the backseat, and decided to ask about him.

"Hey, that's not one of them, is it?"

"No, that's a guy I picked up at the diner a few blocks down. Said his name was Tom Rhelk. Those infected people chased him out of the place, and he flagged me down. I was going almost too fast to see him, I thought he was one of them." He peered through the window at him. "He seems to have calmed down some. He was hysterical earlier... Well, hop in and I'll get you to an exit."

Laura gazed through the back window at this man. He was looking at his feet with his head down. His black hair came down to his jaw, so it hid his features.
Suddenly he lifted and tilted his head just enough so that a single eye stared back at her.

Her mother has been deceased for three years due to cancer. Laura didn't want to leave behind her mother's only inheritance to her. She hooked the weapon on the belt of her jeans for now.

There she saw Officer Cameron, lying on the floor, the police uniform bloodied and torn. His neck had been ripped wide open, his eyes staring at the ceiling. his 9mm pistol clutched in his fingers.

Well, at least she has her own place to stay. Now she will be dependent on you. She stumbles in and crashes on the floor while you close the door behind you. You shake your head and try to collect her from the floor.

"How are you doing Jenny?" "Fi-fine, fine Thomasss". She keeps clinging on you though. You have no choice but to hold her, since she can't stand on her own legs anymore. You gently put her on the bed and prepare what has yet to come. "Ohh Thomas, that was the best night ever!" While you drop your coat on a chair and loosen your shoe lace, you check on your hair again in the mirror. You are here to stay... Ofcourse, she is willing to kill you tomorrow. Or the opposite, she is in love with you. But that's the least of your worries right now. You are gonna get fucked tonight and that's all that counts.

"Say Jenny?", you say to her with a seductive voice. "Yes, hon?" She just stares at her ceiling right now with her arms spread all over the bed. This is perfect, she won't be able to put up some resistance at all right now. "Did you liked how we used to experience all the time tonight?" "Yes, ofcourse honey, I will never forget it, ever!" She turns her head at you and smiles. "Well, if you really liked it, then maybe we can do something else tonight...", you say. "Ohh, what Thomas, what? I can't wait!" You grin and start to strip off your cloths while you walk over to the bed...

Some minutes later, you and Jenny start to make love on the bed. She seems a little surprised and held back at first, but right now, you make her moan with pleasure. You too, have the time of your life. This is a night to remember! Right around then, some idiot starts to bang on the door. Distracted for a little while, you stop your business and look to the door of her apartment. Screams are coming from outside. Again, you can hear someone bang on the door. "Let me in, let me in!", you hear. Under you, Jenny only noticed that you stopped. She looks at you with a begging and confused look in her eyes. "Ahh what the heck..." Your not in the mood to play games with drunken idiots right now. You are tempted to scream something like "Fuck off, i'm busy right now", but that would only ruin the moment.

While more screams come from outside, you resume what you were doing. Outside the screams take an even more desperate tone, but you couldn't care less. There's this wonderfull woman below you and... As you and Jenny start to moan louder and louder, the screams outside slowly fade away...

151122.content:
You look at the clock next to your bed. It's 4 o clock in the morning right now. Next to you, Jenny fell asleep. She will probably have one hell of a hangover tomorrow and maybe get angry with you. No big deal, you've dealt with this before. A bit of acting and some flattery will get you anywhere. Although it is 4 o clock already, you can't get to sleep right now. You decide to stand up and pour yourself a glass of scotch. As you put some ice cubes in the glass and pour the liquid into the glass, you take a look over your shoulder. Jenny is sleeping in your bed with a satisfied smile on her face. You heave your glass and take a sip.

"Cheers babe."

You suddenly remember something vague about screams coming from the front door. You put some comfy cloths on and decide to take a look, just out of curiousity. It wouldn't be the first time you would find some drunken student on the other side of that door. The people in this neighbourhood also have the reputation to like drugs. The other day, Dave, a friend of yours, told you he managed to take some dried mushrooms with him, from his little trip to Amsterdam... Maybe some poor bastard had a bad trip.

You try to open the door something blocks the door from opening. O yeah, the key. Where did you leave it? You take a quick look around. It's on the chair where you left some of your cloths from last night. You try again and unlock the door. You stare outside. That's strange. Usually, you can see all the lights coming from the center of town. Neon commercials, streetlights, light coming from houses and other appartements... Nothing of the sort. Compared to the usual night in Raccoon City, it's completely dark. You can hear some faint screams and the sound of cars a bit further away.

That's when you notice that your socks are all wet. Strange, it hasn't rained the past few days. You take a look to the ground to you that you stand in a puddle of red liquid! Blood?! You take a look at the door. A pair of bloodprints are on your front door! By the shape, you can tell the prints were made by human hands. Ohh wait, that's what it is. You had a bit of a fight with the folks three doors to the left...

"Very funny guys, very funny!"

That's when you notice the traces on the ground. They are made of blood and lead to the stairs... What the hell is going on here?
151122.title: Turn of events

1511222.content:
Waking up a probably very moody girl is not the smartest thing you can do right now. Especially if it comes to gory things. Lets hope you can she won't make a big fuss when she wakes up and lets hope you can dump her as soon as possible. For now, you have other things to worry about. You take a look outside again, ignoring the blood or fake blood for now.

Its awfully quiet. Usually, you can see and hear a lot of activity, even around 4 o clock in the morning. This is a city that never sleeps. Its probably nothing and if you go to bed again and wake up, all you have to worry about is a probably pissed off girl. It is starting to get cold, so you jump over the puddle, pull out your socks and throw them in the sink. There are still red stains on the bottomside of your feet. Meh, it will dry soon enough. Tomorrow morning, you will see where the footsteps will lead you. If it leads to the guys 3 doors to the left, they will be in for a rough time... Just in case, you lock the door and put a chair in front of it.

You walk to your bed again, for all you want to do is sleep now. Inside your bed, Jenny is still fast asleep. She is still cute, even when she sleeps, but its against your policy to date or sleep with the same girl twice... Tomorrow, you will deal with everything, but right now, nothing else can bother you.

"Fuck it".

With those words, you crawl under your sheets again next to Jenny. As soon as you hit your back, you are off again.

info.brief_description: Survive Hell, and don't bring it with you.
info.description:
Story outline: The infection of Raccoon City and the plethora of viruses is in epidemical status. The sickening moans and the screams aren't dieing down any time soon. The nightmare is just beginning, and it doesn't plan on ending. You must survive, at all costs.

Character Choices:

Jack Conway (Age: 30) : A real "Average Joe" who works out of the home. He is well built, as he exercises daily for health reasons. He stays calm in most situations, but the current dilema has him breathing heavy. He is very good at improvising and thinking on his feet.

Akika Tsugi (Age: 19) : A student at the local all-japanese school. She isn't as up to par as the other students, she isn't a slacker she just has trouble understanding the material half the time. She is a bit cowardly, and self-serving, but she has a caring side and she can come through in the most dire times.

John Barl (Age: 42) : A biological engineer for Umbrella Co. He is still at the laboratory while the epidemic is going on at full swing. He has eye problems so he wears fairly thick glasses, he is incredibly genius, and he has a great understanding of the mutations, though not the creatures it has spawned. He is incredibly selfish and greedy. A real "Get in get out" attitude with no time for side distractions.

Laura Brady (Age: 23) : Just getting out of college, Laura is your typical modern college graduate. She tries to keep herself healthy with a good diet and regular exercise. She recently has just bought an apartment in the middle of the city and still hasn't unpacked all her things. She is a fast thinker but her will to take orders from others, even though they may be for the better is a bit lacking. Laura is a real leader, though she lacks in the "team" concept.

Thomas Rhelk (Age: 22) : Didn't have the best grades in school, was a real "Lady's Man". Tom always liked to slack off and pal around with his friends. Tom tried college but quit after four months, a dislike for the atmosphere having him aspire to be a police officer, though before he was off to the trials of the academy the epidemic stopped him. He can act tough but he is a coward at heart, the situation has him in a panic.
___________________

Note: Weapons such as guns are scarce, and more so is the ammunition for them.
The object is to survive, not to kill everything.

Rules:
Characters can meet.
Characters can die.
Characters can escape.
(None of this needs to happen soon in the story.)

Escaping should only happen after about 70+ chapters of a pathway for a character.

Keep things realistic, these people are in a hellish scenario.

I will reply to all additions made to the best of my ability, plus I will be adding on myself.

Have fun.



*******I have noticed 200+ views.. and less than 50 entries.. though this is completely your choice, I'd really like some additions made.********

*****I am on Writing.com EVERY week, usually EVERY day for a bit, I WILL see your chapter as I have this turned on to send me an email when additions are made.*****
info.pretty_title: Raccoon City, the City of Nightmares
